alert.note: Alert for Kohala; Kona (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued January 12 at 3:22PM HST until January 13 at 6:00PM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY FOR NORTH AND WEST FACING SHORES OF NIIHAU KAUAI OAHU AND MOLOKAI FOR NORTH FACING SHORES OF MAUI AND FOR WEST FACING SHORES OF THE BIG ISLAND... .A series of overlapping northwest swells will continue. The current swell will decline through the night, and the next swell will build during the day, possibly pushing surf near High Surf Warning levels late Thursday. ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM HST THURSDAY... ...HIGH SURF WARNING IS CANCELLED... * WHAT...Surf will be 7 to 10 feet through tonight and 6 to 8 feet Thursday. * WHERE...West facing shores of the Big Island. * WHEN...Until 6 PM HST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Moderate. Expect strong breaking waves, shore break, and strong longshore and rip currents making swimming difficult and dangerous.
info.instruction: Beachgoers, swimmers, and surfers should heed all advice given by ocean safety officials and exercise caution.
